episodes.title: Delusions Of Lori: My Rights Have Been Violated!
episodes.description:
Lori Vallow Daybell Demands Dismissal of Arizona Conspiracy Cases: Speedy Trial Rights Violated? | True Crime & High-Demand Religion  

🚨 BREAKING: Lori Vallow Daybell, the infamous "Doomsday Mom," has filed a new motion to dismiss BOTH Arizona conspiracy cases, claiming her speedy trial rights have been violated. Join me LIVE as we dive into the latest developments in this chilling true crime saga, exploring the intersection of high-demand religion, narcissistic abuse, and the quest for justice.  

The details of Lori Vallow Daybell’s latest legal motions and their implications  
How her case ties into patterns of coercive control and institutional narcissism in high-demand religions like the LDS Church  
Insights into the emotional manipulation tactics used in cults and abusive relationships  
What this means for survivors of narcissistic abuse and those exiting controlling religious systems

🔍 As a former Mormon and survivor of narcissistic abuse, I’m here to connect the dots between true crime, healing, and breaking free from coercive systems. Whether you’re fascinated by the Lori Vallow Daybell case, seeking to understand the psychology of cults, or healing from narcissistic relationships, this channel is for you.  

💬 Drop your thoughts in the chat—what do you think about Lori’s latest legal strategy? How do you see high-demand religion playing a role in this case? Let’s discuss!  

🔔 Don’t forget to LIKE, SUBSCRIBE, and hit the bell for more true crime deep dives, insights on exiting high-demand religions, and tools for healing from narcissistic abuse.  

#TrueCrime #LoriVallowDaybell #HighDemandReligion #NarcissisticAbuse #SpeedyTrial #LDSChurch #CultPsychology #HealingJourney #DoomsdayMom #ArizonaCases #CoerciveControl  

Lori Vallow Daybell speedy trial violation  
Arizona conspiracy cases true crime  
High-demand religion and narcissistic abuse

Ex-Mormon insights on Lori Vallow case

Join the conversation and share this stream with anyone interested in true crime, exiting high-demand religions, or healing from narcissistic abuse. Let’s grow this community together!

episodes.title: Losing Faith, Finding Freedom: My Journey Beyond Mormonism
episodes.description: Episode Description: Embark on an intimate exploration with Megan Conner as she recounts the moment her faith in Mormonism unraveled , leading to a profound personal transformation . In this pivotal episode of "The Midlife Revolution," Megan delves deep into the emotional and spiritual upheaval she experienced upon discovering the Church's concealed history and the contradictions within its doctrine . Listen as Megan narrates the story of a family trip that turned into a catalyst for change, where discussions with her sister and cousin about their shared Mormon background led her down a rabbit hole of research and introspection. She reveals how the church's own admissions in the Gospel Topic Essays and historical documents, like the controversial 1922 meetings , challenged her faith to its core, ultimately leading to her decision to step away from the LDS Church . This episode isn't just about loss of faith; it's about finding joy in the vast expanse of "I don't know." Megan discusses the peace and empowerment she discovered in crafting her own values and morality , free from the confines of religious dogma. Learn how she navigated through feelings of betrayal and deception , to emerge with a renewed sense of self , celebrating each moment of life with newfound appreciation. Whether you're on your own journey of faith deconstruction , seeking understanding, or simply curious about the personal impacts of religious transitions , this episode offers solace, insight, and a beacon of hope for those redefining their spiritual identity. Join us in this candid conversation that might just inspire you to question, explore, and redefine your own path to self-discovery.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: I was there:  Lori Vallow's date with her brother Alex, who asked, "Can I borrow g*n? I'm gonna..."
episodes.description:
Exclusive Interview: Inside the Mind of Alex Cox - Lori Vallow's Brother and Alleged Hitman

Randy's book: https://www.amazon.com/Filling-Empty-Randy-C-Watts

Dive deep into the chilling world of one of the most talked-about true crime cases with an exclusive interview featuring a close friend and former coworker of Alex Cox, the brother of Lori Vallow Daybell. This video uncovers two shocking incidents that paint a disturbing picture of Cox's intentions and actions:

The Bizarre Date Proposal: Hear firsthand how Alex Cox extended an unusual invitation for a date where his own sister, Lori Vallow, was to be his date, shedding light on the complex and dark dynamics within their family.
The Gun Borrowing Incident: Discover the harrowing moment when Cox asked to borrow a gun with the explicit intent to murder his brother-in-law, revealing his lethal involvement in the family's sinister plot.

This interview not only explores the depths of narcissism and control within the family but also delves into the influence of their Mormon Church background on these events. Join us as we analyze these explosive revelations with insights into:

True Crime dynamics and the psychology behind such heinous acts.
The role of coercive control within high-demand religions.
The impact of narcissistic personality traits in criminal behavior.

Don't miss this unique opportunity to understand the psyche of Alex Cox through the eyes of someone who knew him personally. Like, comment, and subscribe for more in-depth true crime content that seeks to understand the human aspects behind the headlines.

Lori Vallow Daybell

episodes.title: Former LDS missionary EXPOSES Emotional Manipulation tactics used by the Mormon church
episodes.description:
E Course on how to identify and defend against manipulation tactics! Email askmeegan@gmail.com 

Uncover the hidden tactics used by the LDS Church to convert new members through emotional manipulation. In this eye-opening documentary, we delve deep into the strategies taught to Mormon missionaries, revealing how they target the vulnerable and use psychological techniques to persuade individuals to join the church. Learn about the systematic approach from insider perspectives and expert analyses, and understand the impact of these methods on unsuspecting individuals.

Former missionary exposes the truth! 
Missionary Training: Explore the "Preach My Gospel" manual and other resources that guide missionaries in their conversion efforts.
Emotional Manipulation Techniques: Discover how feelings of loneliness, life transitions, and personal loss are exploited to make converts.
Survivor Stories: Hear firsthand accounts from those who have experienced these tactics and how they've navigated their way to recovery.

Why Watch?
Gain a critical understanding of religious recruitment practices.
Learn to recognize signs of emotional manipulation in various contexts.
Empower yourself with knowledge to heal from or avoid similar experiences.

LDS Church, Mormon Missionaries, Emotional Manipulation, Conversion Tactics, Religious Recruitment, Narcissism, Healing from Abuse, True Crime, Cult Tactics, Religious Manipulation, Mind Control, High Demand Religion, Coercive Control, Spiritual Abuse, Cult Psychology

#MormonExposed

episodes.title: Unmasking the shadow: Comparing Lori Daybell & Ruby Franke's narcissistic traits FT. John Dehlin MSP
episodes.description:
For information on my on-demand E-Course learning to identify and defend against manipulation and control, email: askmeegan@gmail.com

Join me in an eye-opening exploration as we delve into the chilling parallels between Lori Vallow Daybell and Ruby Franke, two women whose lives have spiraled into true crime infamy. With the expert insights of John Dehlin, Ph.D., from the renowned "Mormon Stories" podcast, we navigate the murky waters where LDS teachings, narcissistic personality traits, and criminal actions meet.

In this video, we dissect:
Personality Traits: A deep dive into the narcissistic behaviors exhibited by both Lori and Ruby, exploring how these traits influenced their actions.
Religious Beliefs: How their interpretations of Mormon doctrine, particularly around family roles, discipline, and doomsday scenarios, led to radical decisions.
Crimes Committed: An analysis of the crimes each woman is accused of, from child abuse in Ruby's case to conspiracy to murder in Lori's, highlighting the impact of their beliefs and personalities.

John Dehlin's psychological expertise helps us understand:
The psychological mechanisms behind their actions.
How religious extremism can be a breeding ground for such behaviors.
The cultural and doctrinal elements of Mormonism that might enable or exacerbate these tendencies.

Why Watch?
Gain a unique perspective on how personal beliefs and psychological disorders can intersect to produce tragic outcomes.
Understand the broader implications of these cases on the LDS community and the true crime genre.
Hear firsthand from someone who has been intimately involved in discussing and analyzing these issues within the context of Mormonism.

Don't forget to:
Like, Comment, and Subscribe for more thought-provoking content at the intersection of religion, psychology, and crime.
Share your thoughts on how these cases reflect on or challenge your understanding of religious teachings and human behavior.

#TrueCrime #Narcissism #Mormonism


Lori Vallow Daybell, Ruby Franke, John Dehlin, Mormon Stories, LDS Church, Narcissistic Personality Disorder, Child Abuse, Conspiracy to Murder, Religious Extremism, Doomsday Beliefs, True Crime Analysis, Psychological Insights, Mormon Doctrine, Family Vlog Crimes, Cult Behavior, Criminal Psychology, Faith and Crime.

Watch now to dissect this disturbing convergence of faith, narcissism, and crime, offering a nuanced look at two of the most talked-about cases in recent years.

Note: This video discusses sensitive topics including child abuse, murder, and psychological disorders. Viewer discretion is advised.

episodes.title: Millions were Brainwashed
episodes.description: As a 7th generation Mormon, I talk about my experiences being indoctrinated into the LDS faith, and how the programs and rhetoric of the church leaders make it impossible for young people to have informed consent when choosing church membership. I offer unique insights into indoctrination tactics and why it is that millions of LDS members believe that they are not in a cult. Is brainwashing too harsh of a description for what I endured? episodes.description: Heal: We all have wounds. Let's heal them for our own lives and the ones we love. Healing is the beginning of a series of mini-episodes that will address many of the tools that I learned in my therapeutic process. Most people need some form of healing, but not everyone is ready for therapy. Using these tools, individuals can assess where they are on their mental health journey, and start the process while also assessing what healing modality might work best for them. episodes.title: Please Cry!
episodes.description: Megan Conner is an author, coach, and mother of 6 spectacular human beings. Megan is not a mental health professional, but she is an expert on her own healing from cPTSD after a lifetime of abuse. In sharing her journey with others, Megan hopes to spread the message that not only is it possible to heal, it's possible to have a happy and peaceful life after trauma. In a recent live Q&A, Megan's channel members had a chance to ask her questions about processing and releasing emotions. This episode features the sections of that discussion that focus on the healing power of crying.
subjects: Psychology

episodes.title: Self
episodes.description: Self: In his book “No Bad Parts”, Dr, Schwartz reveals that just under the surface of these wounded parts is a Self which cannot be hurt, knows how to heal both internally and externally, and has characteristics which represent the highest and best of what we can become as human beings. He refers to these traits as the 8 C’s of self-leadership, and I would like to touch on each of these today. As we walk through these traits, I will give some examples from my own healing journey to help illustrate how these characteristics can help us heal our relationship with our Self so that we can then have healthier external relationships as well. Remember that the Midlife Revolution is all about small changes, so I’m not asking anyone to absorb and practice all 8 of these at once. My hope is that you will pick one that resonates with you and feels safe to try. Feel free to save and share this episode so that you can come back to it when you’re ready to try the next one. About the Host: Megan Conner is the mother of 6 spectacular humans and a breaker of generational trauma cycles. She has spent the last 10 years overcoming the effects of child SA and other abusive relationships and cycles. episodes.title: LDS
episodes.description: To my friends in the church after I've left: We learn so much when we listen to voices that express opinions different from our own. One of the best practices we can adopt in our healing journey is to express criticism without judgment, and to accept criticism without shame. In this episode, I express my respect for members of the LDS faith, and discuss three of the issues that I would like LDS members to understand. Megan Conner is the mother of 6 spectacular humans and a breaker of generational trauma cycles. She has spent the last 10 years overcoming the effects of child SA and other abusive relationships and cycles. episodes.title: Care
episodes.description: Care: The radical love of self care and how to make it a daily practice Megan helps listeners understand that prioritizing our own mental health is important if we want to be able to show up for others. Megan gives examples of how she does this in her own life and gives suggestions for listeners as well. episodes.title: Kitchen
episodes.description: When I decided to reorganize my kitchen, I had no idea that I would be confronting some leftover old beliefs that originated with my relationship with my mother. In this episode, I address these concepts and how I overcame them. I discuss how changing my kitchen is a metaphor for the way I changed my life. I also give some practical tips for how to make your kitchen more efficient and how to decide what to keep and what to say goodbye to. About the Host: Megan Conner is the mother of 6 spectacular humans and a breaker of generational trauma cycles.
